title: Drawing, "Two Circular and Octagonal Painting for Ceiling: Deeds of Alexander the Great", ca. 1795
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: Alessandro taglia il nodo/ Gordiano; vittoria delle armi; vittoria del mondo
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Alexander swings his sword to cut Gordian knot, wound around shaft of chariot. Flanking with two Victories facing each other, left one carries panoply, right one globe.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Two Circular and Octagonal Painting for Ceiling: Deeds of Alexander the Great", ca. 1795.Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3366.
